words.source: H559 ʾamar, Qal wayyiqtol 3ms; KJV/ESV/NASB 'said'
H4872 Mosheh, proper noun; KJV/ESV/NASB 'Moses'
H413 ʾel, preposition; KJV 'unto', ESV/NASB 'to'
H3068 YHWH, proper noun divine; KJV/ESV/NASB 'the LORD'
H994 bi, interjection of entreaty; KJV 'O', ESV 'Oh', NASB 'Please' — DIVERGENT: different English renderings of entreaty particle
H136 ʾAdonay, noun mp + 1cs suffix; KJV 'my Lord', ESV 'my Lord', NASB 'Lord'
H3808 loʾ, negative particle; KJV/ESV/NASB 'not'
H376 ʾish, noun ms; KJV 'eloquent', ESV 'eloquent', NASB 'eloquent' — note: 'man of words' is Hebrew idiom for eloquent speaker
H1697 davar, noun mp; KJV 'eloquent' (paraphrased), ESV 'eloquent' (paraphrased), NASB 'eloquent' (paraphrased) — lit. 'man of words'
H595 ʾanokhi, pronoun 1cs; KJV 'I am', ESV 'I am', NASB 'I have'
H1571 gam, adverb; KJV 'neither', ESV 'either', NASB 'either'
H8543 temol, adverb + preposition min; KJV 'heretofore', ESV 'in the past', NASB 'in the past' — DIVERGENT: KJV archaic 'heretofore' vs modern 'in the past'
H1571 gam, adverb; KJV 'nor', ESV 'nor', NASB 'nor'
H8032 shilshom, adverb + preposition min; KJV 'since thou hast spoken', ESV 'since you have spoken', NASB 'since You have spoken' — note: Hebrew idiom temol-shilshom = 'previously, in times past'
H1571 gam, adverb; KJV 'nor', ESV 'but', NASB 'even'
H227 ʾaz, adverb + preposition min; KJV 'since', ESV 'since', NASB 'since'
H1696 davar, Piel infinitive construct + 2ms suffix; KJV 'thou hast spoken', ESV 'you have spoken', NASB 'You have spoken'
H413 ʾel, preposition; KJV 'unto', ESV/NASB 'to'
H5650 ʿeved, noun ms + 2ms suffix; KJV 'thy servant', ESV/NASB 'your servant'
H3588 ki, conjunction; KJV 'for', ESV 'but', NASB 'for' — DIVERGENT: ESV 'but' vs KJV/NASB 'for'
H3515 kaved, adjective ms; KJV 'slow', ESV 'slow', NASB 'slow' — note: lit. 'heavy' of mouth = slow of speech
H6310 peh, noun ms; KJV 'of speech', ESV 'of speech', NASB 'of speech' — note: 'heavy of mouth' = difficulty speaking
H3515 kaved, adjective ms + waw conjunction; KJV 'and of a slow', ESV 'and of', NASB 'and slow of'
H3956 lashon, noun ms; KJV 'tongue', ESV 'tongue', NASB 'tongue'
H595 ʾanokhi, pronoun 1cs; KJV 'I am', ESV 'I am', NASB 'I am'
